Sentences: Mi does go market every Sat'day.
She ain't eat yet cause she di wait pon you.
If it rain tomorrow, we go stay home.
Mi bin wuk hard all week long.
We goin beach later if de sun come out.
Dem man done clean up de yard before noon.
Mi wouldn’a say dat if mi know better.
Dis food does get cold fast.
It get build by de same people last year.
Mi ain't never see nottin so sweet before!

— Wah you doin dis weekend?
— Mi goin Carnival!

— Gyal, you hear de news?
— No, tell mi now!

— Mi hungry bad.
— Le’ we stop by Auntie shop den.

— You remember she?
— Yeah, from primary school!

— Mi phone dead.
— Use mine quick quick.

— You lookin vex.
— Mi just tired, das all.

— How yuh mudda?
— She good, she restin now.

— Wah time it is?
— Quarter to ten, mi fren.

— Mi cyaah find mi key.
— You check inna yuh bag?

— Le' we limin later.
— Say less, mi deh wid you.
Mi deh tired oui, dat wuk mash up mi back.
She say she goin “downtown” after she cook.
Mi get vex an tell him straight up: “Don’t play wid me!”
De event start at 7 sharp, so be on time.
Yuh hear de gyal? She jus' deh there singin Spanish tune!
Dis one a real 'bougie', always talkin bout fashion week.
Mi boss text mi, ‘Bring di report by noon’, cho!
He always deh mix up he English an Creole.
Mi neighbor always shoutin, ‘Buenos días!’ in de mawnin.
Dem child goin bilingual school, talkin both proper an Creole.

Sentences: Doctor recommend light exercise an balanced diet.
Who cyaah hear, mus’ feel.
One one coco full basket.
What sweet in goat mouth does sour in e belly.
Tek front before front tek you.
Monkey know which tree to climb.
Big tree fall down, goat jump cross.
Trouble don’t set like rain.
Time longer dan rope.
Cockroach ain’t got no business in fowl fight.
Every day bucket go a well, one day di bottom drop out.

Q: Wah time de boat reach?
A: Round 3 o’clock.

Q: Who cook dis food?
A: Mi uncle, he ah real chef.

Q: How much it cost?
A: ‘Bout twenty-five dollar.

Q: Where de restroom deh?
A: Right side, past de bar.

Q: You see mi bag?
A: Check by de chair dem.

Q: Why you leavin early?
A: Mi haffu pick up mi chile.

Q: You been Carnival last night?
A: Yeah, it was sweet!

Q: Who win de match?
A: Saints mash up de other side.

Q: Mi could borrow your charger?
A: Of course, take it.

Q: Dis yuh first time here?
A: Nah, mi bin come last year too.
Close de door before de skeeta dem come in.
Tek yuh shoes off when you reach inside.
Come le’ we go now before it start rainin.
Tell she mi gone by Granny house.
Stop playin an come eat yuh food!
Call de man an ask bout de delivery.
Bring two bottle a water from de shop.
Hurry up an get dress, we late already.
Watch out, de step slippery!
Pick up dem clothes from de line before dark.
